subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Blue Jays designated hitter Frank Thomas was upset after being benched in favor of Matt Stairs and being told by Manager John Gibbons he can expect further cuts to his playing time. Thomas, who is batting .167 with 3 homers and 11 runs batted in in 60 at-bats, signed a two-year, $18-million contract with Toronto in November 2006. The deal includes a $10 million option for 2009, but only if Thomas makes 376 plate appearances this season. Thomas, 39, said the Blue Jays were cutting his playing time to prevent the option from kicking in. Thomas has 516 career homers.
